roll.android: You lose motor control for a moment as your sensory inputs flicker.
roll.human: Your heartbeat races out of control and you start to feel dizzy.

success.android: System resources free up and you regain control.
success.human: You take a deep breath and regain your composure.

roll.human: You put your ship on emergency power, seal yourselves in cryopods, send out a Distress Signal, and wait for help. It’s a long shot, but sometimes it’s the only shot you’ve got. Will you be found?
You perform a full inspection of the ship for wear and tear.

success.human: You find nothing wrong with the ship.

add.android: You now suffer from this condition
add.human: You now suffer from this condition

bleed.android: Your sensors detect significant nanofluid loss.
bleed.human: You feel dizzy as you bleed out.

radiation.human: You stare into blackness and feel completely unable to pull yourself out of it.

cryo.android: Your systems malfunction from the condensation damage.
cryo.human: You awaken cold and frigid, barely able to move.

increase.android: Power surges through your chest and you start to overheat.
increase.human: You feel tightness in your chest and start to sweat.

hitCeiling.android: System performance grinds to a halt.

pastCeiling.human: You feel a part of yourself drift away.

decrease.android: You soft-reset, purging unnecessary background processes.
decrease.human: You feel a sense of calm wash over you.

hitFloor.android: You attain perfect focus and clarity.
hitFloor.human: You attain complete peace of mind.

pastFloor.android: You are already as focused as possible.
pastFloor.human: You are already as calm as possible.

check.human: You successfully manuever the craft through danger.

increase.human: Thrusters upgraded. Agility, acceleration, and top speed have improved.

pastCeiling.human: Your thrusters are already at maximum and cannot be improved further.

decrease.human: Thrusters damaged. Agility, acceleration, and top speed are impaired.

pastFloor.human: Your thrusters are broken and cannot be damaged further.

check.human: You land a successful hit on the target.

increase.human: Targeting systems upgraded. Combat readiness has improved.

hitCeiling.human: Your targeting systems are at maximum.

pastCeiling.human: Your targeting systems are already at maximum and cannot be improved further.

decrease.human: Targeting systems damaged. Combat readiness have been impaired.

pastFloor.human: Your targeting systems are broken and cannot be damaged further.

check.human: Your ship's systems are running smoothly.

increase.human: Systems upgraded. Sensors, computers, and other systems have improved.

hitCeiling.human: Your ship's systems are at maximum.

pastCeiling.human: Your ship's systems are already at maximum and cannot be improved further.

decrease.human: Systems damaged. Sensors, computers, and other systems have been impaired.

pastFloor.human: Your ship's systems are broken and cannot be damaged further.

CharacterGenerator.name: Character Generator
CharacterGenerator.CommonSkillExplanation: This is a list of usual skill for this class to be used for random character generation.
CharacterGenerator.StatOptionPopupText: Choose where to apply the bonus of:
CharacterGenerator.SkillOption.Classerror: You need to select a class first.
CharacterGenerator.SkillOption.PopupFullMasterDescription: Choose 1 Master skill, and an Expert and Trained Skill prerequisite.
CharacterGenerator.SkillOption.PopupFullExperDescription: Choose 1 Expert skill, and Trained Skill prerequisite.
CharacterGenerator.SkillOption.ChoiceText: Choose 1 from these skill bonus options
CharacterGenerator.Error.NoClass: You need to select a class first.

Mosh.AllStatsAndSavesDecreasedBy: All stats and saves decreased by
Mosh.classNewStatOptionEmptyError: You must select at least two stat or saves
Mosh.DoNotAddASkillToThisRoll: Do not add a skill to this roll.
Mosh.MoraleCheckDescription: After any Ship Round where an enemy takes MDMG, they must make a Morale Check. To make a Morale Check, roll 1d10. If they roll under their current MDMG, they may send a hail offering a ceasefire and to resume negotiations.
Mosh.Name: Name
Mosh.YouRolled90OrHigher: You rolled 90 or higher, which is always considered a failure.
Mosh.ChooseTheStatForSkillCheck: Choose the Stat that best suits the nature of this Skill Check. You will add your skill bonus to the Stat value for this roll
Mosh.GivingYouAHigherNumber: (giving you a higher number to roll under).
Mosh.StrengthSkillExample: Holding airlocks closed, carrying fallen comrades, climbing, pushing, jumping.
Mosh.SpeedSkillExample: Getting out of the cargo bay before the blast doors close, acting before someone (or something) else, running away.
Mosh.IntellectSkillExample: Recalling your training and experience under duress, thinking through difficult problems, inventing or fixing things.
Mosh.IfYouHaveARelevantSkill: If you have a Skill that is relevant to the task at hand, you can add the Skill’s bonus to your Stat or Save before making your roll
Mosh.TheEnvironmentCanProvideProtectionCalled: The environment can provide protection called
Mosh.IfYouShotWhileInCover: If you shoot while in Cover, you are considered out of Cover until your next turn
Mosh.ItCanBeDestroyedLikeArmor: It can be destroyed, just like armor, whenever it is dealt Damage greater than or equal to its AP. Cover typically only protects against ranged attacks, but in some situations may help block a hand-to-hand attack.
Mosh.YourCoverValuesAreDisplayedIn: Your Cover values are displayed in
Mosh.UnprotectedOutInTheOpen: Unprotected, out in the open, etc.
Mosh.TreesBulkheadWallMetalFurniture: Trees, bulkhead walls, metal furniture, etc.
Mosh.AirlockDoorsCementBeamsShips: Airlock doors, cement beams, ships, etc.
Mosh.DistressSignalTableExplanation: Occasionally you may need to put your ship on emergency power, seal yourselves in cryopods, send out a Distress Signal, and wait for help. It’s a long shot, but sometimes it’s the only shot you’ve got. When this happens, roll on this table.
Mosh.MaintenanceCheckExplanation1: Eventually, your ship needs a tune-up, or sometimes a complete overhaul. When this happens, you’ll need to get it repaired.
Mosh.MinorRepairsExplanation: cover cosmetic damage, cleanup, and other handyman type work that can be handled in flight, usually within 2d10 days
Mosh.MayorRepairsExplanation: cover large scale structural or system damage, including repairing Megadamage and Hull, and can only be fixed in port.
Mosh.BankrupcyCheckExplanation: A slim minority of ships are owned by small banking firms who share ownership with the operators, fronting all costs of the vessel and taking most of the profits. In exchange, you get a ship and a relatively free hand in conducting your business on the Rim. Each year
Mosh.OrQuarterAsDeterminedBWarden: or quarter, as determined by your Warden
Mosh.BankrupcySaveExplanationEnd: to determine the financial health of the company
Mosh.OutOfAmmoNeedReload: Out of ammo, you need to reload
Mosh.YouAddThisToYourInventory: You add this to your inventory.
Mosh.YouAddAnotherOfThisToYourInventory: You add another one of these to your inventory.
Mosh.HealthZeroMessage: Your health has hit zero and you must take a wound.
Mosh.HealthZeroMessage2: Your health has hit zero and you must take a wound. Your health has been reset to
Mosh.YouSenseTheWeightOfYourSetbacks: You sense the weight of your setbacks.
